value.title: Is Facial Recognition a Useful Public Safety Tool or Something Sinister?
value.excerpt: In August 2023, the Chinese government issued draft regulations that aim to limit the private use of facial recognition technologies; the rules impose no such restrictions on its use for "national security" concerns.

value.title: Corydon: Five arrests after Met Police uses live facial recognition
value.excerpt: The Metropolitan Police has arrested five people after using Live Facial Recognition (LFR) technology in south London. The force said it deployed the technology in Croydon on 19 January as part of its work to "reduce serious violence". Civil liberties organisation Liberty called the Met's use of the technology "deeply concerning".
